result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:06 AM cases 22CM282, 22CM356 called. Defendant Tara L McBride in court.  Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk in court for Tara L McBride.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense enters not guilty pleas which are accepted by the Court. Cases referred to branch 4 to schedule a status conference. `
Court indicates: motion withdrawn
Hearing on September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Cases 22CM282, 22CM356 are called at 11:02 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Tara L McBride appeared by video from WMHI.  Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk in court for Tara L McBride. Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense stipulates to Dr.'s report and findings. State stipulates to Dr.'s report and findings. Court finds the Defendant is competent to proceed. Defense withdraws Motion to Withdraw as Counsel- Attorney Van Daalwyk to remain as counsel. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/12/2022 at 1:30 PM. 
Hearing: 09/22/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely
The Court Orders: Tara L. McBride may appear remotely for the proceeding scheduled on 08/15/2022.
Proposed Order on Request to Appear Remotely
Dated 08/12/2022, Letter from Attorney Jansen Van Daalwyk to Court requesting defendant be allowed to appear by Zoom for 08/15/2022 Competency Hearing.

*CONFIDENTIAL*
by Dr. Donna Minter, dated 08/12/2022
Proposed Order Allowing Withdrawal of Counsel
Affidavit in Support of Motion to Withdraw as Counsel by Attorney Jansen Van Daalwyk

Cases called at 3:30 PM: 22CM282, 22CM356.
Defendant Tara L McBride in court with Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin.  
State notes that the Defendant has not yet completed the Competency Examination.  
Attorney Van Daalwyk indicates that the Defendant was in treatment through 6/24/22 and will now be available to complete the examination. 
Defendant instructed to contact Dr. Minter to make arrangements to complete the examination.
Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Competency Hearing: 8/15/22 at 11:00 AM.
from Dr. Minter of the WI Forensic Unit to the Court with update on communication attempts with Defendant
Competency hearing on July 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Dated 05/13/2022, Letter from Dr. Donna Minter to Court requesting an extension for the competency evaluation.

10:03 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tara L McBride not in court.  Attorney Jansen James Van Daalwyk in court for Tara L McBride. 
Parties unsure as to why this case is scheduled in intake. Defendant already has a competency hearing scheduled in Branch 5.

Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on May 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Dated 04/18/2022, Letter from Attorney Jansen Van Daalwyk regarding filing of Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
